info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 22 at 2:21PM EST until December 22 at 8:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM FRIDAY TO NOON EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. Winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Otsego, Delaware and Sullivan counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 8 PM EST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 5 PM Friday to noon EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. Tree limbs could be blown down and scattered power outages may result. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A strong cold front will cross the region on Friday. A lull in the winds may occur Friday morning, but winds will pick up again after frontal passage and shift to the southwest.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
